content.description: Start in middle of boulder on good jugs, and climb up steep face on large holds.
content.location: This boulder faces north and is about 15ft downhill from Mike's Boulder.

content.description: Lower start to Mike's Boulder.   Right hand is on undercling, but your left hand starts lower down on small edge.  Make a couple of desperate moves to link into Mike's Boulder.

Amazing Boulder!  This is the stand start to what could be a couple really hard roof lines. 

  Reach up and grab good edge with left hand and right hand goes up to a crimp at the lip.  Hike feet and get up to jugs over lip.  Upper slab is a bit tricky so heads up.
content.location: This boulder is very large and sits just south of Mike's Boulder at the base of Lost Face.

content.description: An aesthetic, unlikely looking, slope fest knife feature just next to Blade Runner.Start from a sit, right with an incut jug and left underclinging the blade.  Climb straight up through slopey holds with balance, and toss to gain better holds.  Mantle and climb into the trees.Note: the fall is pretty good but a spotter is a good idea.  It wouldn’t be good to miss the landing zone.
content.location: Just next to and left of Blade Runner.  40 yards south and a little uphill from the Power Bottom Boulder.

content.description: This is the low start to "Power Hour" and the real line on the right side of the boulder.  Start low on a left hand undercling and a right hand crimp / pinch and make a big move (Nic), use some toe hook wizardry (Peter), or something else (???) to gain the rail on "Power Hour."  Top out on that problem.
Start on slanting jug right of roof (same as Fully Charged).  Trend left and finish as for Power Bottom and Real Power.

To the right of Power Bottom in the roof.  From a stand I started crossed, w/ right hand on a blocky pinch, and left on a false grip undercling down and right.  Use tension to climb out the roof and finish on the big slab.
Start on two good head height edges under the roof.  Do a couple of powerful moves to reach the lip and top out.  This is a lower start to the problem "Take a Stand".
content.protection: Couple of pads and a heads up attitude for the long, exposed topout
content.location: If you're facing Jenga, walk to the left and ever so slightly uphill for a minute or two and you will run into this boulder.

content.description: Sit start with two large side-pulls.  Hike feet and mantle into the face.  The goal is to gain the upper sloper and stand up to the top.  Very Tricky.
content.location: This boulder is between Mike's Boulder and the Warm-up.

content.description: Start under boulder with right hand undercling and left on crimp.  Bump to edge and toss out left for good hold.  Swing your feet up and make your way right to jug.  Top-out.
content.location: Mike's Boulder is in the middle of the cluster.  Lost wall is directly above by about 50ft.

content.description: Start with slanting jug right of Real Power.  Climb the tall arête with the hardest moves being low, though the top is thin and you are definitely still climbing.  The landing is not good for a fall up high, be careful! You can pull on from a neighboring boulder and work any of the moves.

A low start to Power Bottom starting with the two obvious far edges in the same seam as the OG start holds of Power Bottom.  Probably establish on the wall by facing out and getting a toe hook on the lip.
From a sit, matched on a sloper, climb the overhanging blade feature. Other walls and boulders are not used.
content.location: Just next to and south of the Power Bottom Boulder.

content.description: A cluster of large boulders with lots of roofs and overhangs.     Loads of potentail for steep, hard climbs.
